result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebekah L Steidl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft [Modifiers: Party to a Crime]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be at $50.00 per month, commencing 05-02-2016, alternate 5 days jail if not paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebekah L Steidl

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Voss.

Defendant Rebekah L Steidl in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to county ordinance theft.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $267.50-to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 5/2/16, alternate 5 days jail if not paid.

Defendant Rebekah L Steidl in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rebekah L Steidl in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests an adjournment to review reports.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Atty Voss has been appointed (Contract). Defendant to pay: $50/month commencing on 01/04/16.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rebekah L Steidl in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she did not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel.  Court reviews petition and grants Defendant's request.  Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 1/4/16 until paid in full.  Court sets review date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Rebekah L Steidl in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
